channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Inside the secret history of Design for Good, an alliance between companies with $4 trillion in market cap to devise solutions to the world’s biggest problems
item.description: Design for Good co-founder Ben Sheppard explains why big names like Microsoft, Nestle and DBS got involved.

item.title: Polio is a deadly disease with a vaccine that RFK Jr.’s adviser wants to ban. Here’s how the immunization works
item.description: The polio vaccine has all but obliterated the illness that once killed thousands and paralyzed 15,000 people nationwide every year.

item.title: Images Suggest Russia Is Packing Up Equipment in Syria
item.description: Satellite images reveal military movements that could be a possible prelude to Moscow’s withdrawal. An American found in Damascus this week was handed...

item.title: Canada’s Gas Brings Indigenous People New Money, and Old Worries
item.description: New export terminals along the rugged Pacific coastline have reignited a generations-old debate over identity and environmental stewardship.

item.title: McConnell Defends Polio Vaccine, an Apparent Warning to RFK Jr.
item.description: “Efforts to undermine public confidence in proven cures are not just uninformed — they’re dangerous,” said the Republican leader, who is a polio survi...

item.title: F.B.I. Passed Tip About Mangione to New York Police After C.E.O. Killing
item.description: It was unclear when the information arrived, or whether it would have helped speed an arrest in the death of Brian Thompson, the chief executive of Un...

item.title: South Korea’s President Faces New Impeachment Vote
item.description: President Yoon Suk Yeol’s ruling party blocked the opposition’s first attempt a week ago after his short-lived attempt to declare martial law.

item.title: Skechers draw backlash for full-page ad in Vogue that reeks of AI. ‘You actually didn’t save any money because now I hate you’
item.description: The footwear retail company recently came under fire for allegations of using AI. Other corporations are also getting in trouble for said usage.

item.title: Singer Turns ‘Feliz Navidad’ Into Protest Anthem Against Yoon Suk Yeol
item.description: Baek Jae Gil, whose viral anthem calls for the ouster of President Yoon Suk Yeol, has a long history with the country’s pro-democracy movement.

item.title: Are ‘blue zones’ a myth? Extreme aging is built on pension fraud and century-old lies, researcher claims
item.description: New research suggests the world’s oldest humans, living in so-called "blue zones", often only exist on paper.

item.title: Oregon city asks people to please stop putting googly eyes on public art as prank becomes tourist attraction
item.description: The city has so far spent $1,500 on removing googly eyes from seven of the eight sculptures impacted.

item.title: Europe Begins to Ask if Syrians Can Go Home After al-Assad’s Fall
item.description: Nearly a million Syrians in Germany alone have made new lives. But after the fall of Bashar al-Assad, some politicians across the continent have sugge...

item.title: South Korea’s President Faces New Impeachment Vote
item.description: President Yoon Suk Yeol’s ruling party blocked the opposition’s first attempt a week ago after his short-lived attempt to declare martial law.

item.title: CEO’s Killing Poses Test for New NYPD Commissioner Jessica Tisch
item.description: Weeks ago, Jessica Tisch was in charge of street sweeping and trash pickup. On Monday, she found herself overseeing a ferocious manhunt as the head of...

item.title: Singer Turns ‘Feliz Navidad’ Into Protest Anthem Against Yoon Suk Yeol
item.description: Baek Jae Gil, whose viral anthem calls for the ouster of President Yoon Suk Yeol, has a long history with the country’s pro-democracy movement.
